framework.core

Class Canvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.core.Canvas

  • public class Canvas
extends Object
    Canvas is a class to allow for simple graphical drawing on a canvas. This is a modification of the general purpose Canvas, specially made for the BlueJ "shapes" example.
    Version:
    1.6 (shapes)
    Author:
    Bruce Quig, Michael Kölling (mik), Hans Ferchland (modified)

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Force the drawing of a given shape onto the canvas.

      Draws a line on the Canvas.

      Draws a String on the Canvas.

      Erase a given shape's from the screen.

      Erases a String on the Canvas.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(CanvasObject referenceObject,
        Color color,
        Shape shape)
        Force the drawing of a given shape onto the canvas. The CanvasObject will be added to drawing here.
        Parameters:
        referenceObject - an object to define identity for this shape
        color - the color of the shape
        shape - the shape object to be drawn on the canvas

      • drawImage

        public boolean drawImage(Image image,
                int x,
                int y)
        Draws an image onto the canvas.
        Parameters:
        image - the image
        x - the x
        y - the y
        Returns:
        returns boolean value representing whether the image was completely loaded

      • drawLine

            int y1,
            int x2,
            int y2)
        Draws a line on the Canvas.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the x1
        y1 - the y1
        x2 - the x2
        y2 - the y2

      • drawString

        public void drawString(String text,
              int x,
              int y)
        Draws a String on the Canvas.
        Parameters:
        text - the text
        x - the x
        y - the y

      • erase

        public void erase(Object referenceObject)
        Erase a given shape's from the screen.
        Parameters:
        referenceObject - the shape object to be erased

               int x,

        Parameters:

        x - the x
        y - the y

      • wait

        public void wait(int milliseconds)
        Wait for a specified number of milliseconds before finishing. This provides an easy way to specify a small delay which can be used when producing animations.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the number
